intro: Myrsine dentata, commonly known as the serrated myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant features small, opposite leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in small inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds.
